name: General Knowledge 15 Quiz | Mixed 25 Questions | 25 Questions

questions.text: In the film 'Nanook of the North' (1922), 'nanook' is the Canadian word for ...  ?
questions.explanation:
Polar bear.

	It is derived from the Eskimo word 'nanug'.

questions.text: The Aswan Dam is a huge Egyptian dam which contains the waters of which river?
questions.explanation:
Nile.

	The first Aswan Dam was completed in 1902 to establish flood control on the Nile. The present dam was built with Soviet aid between 1960 and 1970.

questions.text: Former Pakistan cricket captain Imran Khan married Jemima ...  ?
questions.explanation: Goldsmith.

questions.text: The first thorough survey of most of England was recorded by William the Conqueror in the Domesday Book in what year?
questions.explanation:
1086.

	Its purpose was to determine potential crown revenue and it lists property and resources manor by manor.

questions.text: Which board game was invented by A. Pratt?
questions.explanation:
Cluedo.

	Anthony Pratt.

questions.text: In the children's television programme, what is the name of Captain Pugwash's ship?
questions.explanation: The Black Pig.

questions.text: What is the name of the monumental concrete statue on a hilltop in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, which stands 125 feet tall with an outstretched arms span of 92 feet. Christ the ...?
questions.explanation: Redeemer.

questions.text: During World War Two, what was the name given to the alliance of Nazi Germany, Fascist Italy and Japan?
questions.explanation:
Axis.

	Established in October 1936 between Germany and Italy with Japan joining them in September 1940.

questions.text: Which Englishman of the following has played agent 007 James Bond?
questions.explanation:
Roger Moore.

	Roger Moore was born in Stockwell, South London. Timothy Dalton born Colwyn Bay, north Wales. Pierce Brosnan born in Drogheda, Ireland and Sean Connery in Edinburgh, Scotland.

questions.text: Name the 1868 novel by Dostoevsky. The ...  ?
questions.explanation:
Idiot.

	Fyodor Dostoevsky was a Russian novelist who joined a revolutionary group. When arrested he was sentenced to death but was reprieved at the eleventh hour and was sentenced to four years' hard labour.

questions.text: Which of the following books was NOT written by Michael Crichton?
questions.explanation:
The Shining.

	'The Shining' was written by Stephen King.

questions.text: The sound barrier is broken at speeds over ...  ?
questions.explanation:
750 mph.

	The speed of sound in dry air at standard temperature and pressure is 750 mph and depends on the height above sea level.

questions.text: Which Scottish island is situated north-west of Eigg?
questions.explanation: Rhum.

questions.text: Name the type of penguin found abundant around the Falkland Islands and Antarctica?
questions.explanation: Gentoo.

questions.text: In the book by Roald Dahl, 'Charlie and the Chocolate Factory', what is Charlie's surname?
questions.explanation: Bucket.

questions.text: In Florida what does the letter 'E' stand for in the acronym 'EPCOT' as in the EPCOT centre?
questions.explanation:
Experimental.

	Experimental Prototype Community Of Tomorrow.

questions.text: Which of the following was a novel by E.M. Forster?
questions.explanation:
Howard's End.

	Ian Lancaster Fleming wrote 13 escapist spy thrillers about James Bond. He wrote 'Goldfinger' in 1959. 'My Left Foot' was written by Christy Brown. 'Prizzi's Honor' was written by Richard Condon.

questions.text: Which French physicist invented neon lighting. Georges ...?
questions.explanation:
Claude.

	Invented in 1910.

questions.text: Who was the first English writer to be awarded the Nobel prize for literature?
questions.explanation:
Rudyard Kipling.

	He was awarded the Nobel Prize for literature in 1907.

questions.text: How old was Geronimo, the famous Apache Indian chief, when he died?
questions.explanation:
80 years old.

	He died on 17th Feb. 1909.

questions.text: Who wrote the novel 'To the Lighthouse' (1927)?
questions.explanation: Virginia Woolf.

questions.text: Which country's flag has a green five-pointed star called 'Solomon's seal' on a red background?
questions.explanation: Morocco.

questions.text: The ...people live in southern Myanmar?
questions.explanation: Karen.

questions.text: Whilst working on which Hitchcock film did Grace Kelly meet her future husband Prince Rainier III?
questions.explanation:
To Catch a Thief.

	He was the ruler of the small principality of Monaco and were married in 1956.

questions.text: The Traveller's tree looks like a giant fan whose seeds are used for food. In which country can it be found?
questions.explanation:
Madagascar.

	This large tree-like plant is endemic to Madagascar and has banana-like leaves reaching a length of about ten feet long. Hope you enjoyed the quiz.
